name: Trailside Trout with Walnut-Herb Stuffing
author: Jeff Cummings
summary: Great for those backpacking trips to trout-stocked lakes. It's like having a gourmet meal in the wilderness.
directions: At home: Mix cracker crumbs, walnuts, and dill in a resealable plastic bag
Store oil, watercress, water onion, parsley, and soy sauce in individual bags and containers and combine them in a larger, self-sealing plastic bag labeled with recipe instructions
On the trail: Place onion in a skillet with 1 tablespoon of the oil
Cook and stir over low to medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes
Cover and steam for a minute or so; stir in the watercress
Combine the cracker-walnut mixture with the onion-parsley mixture in a medium bowl to make the stuffing
Stuff each trout with 1/4 of the walnut-herb stuffing
Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat and add remaining 2 tablespoons oil
Add trout to skillet, cover, and cook until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 10 minutes per side
